@tooldrool @championswimmer @sandeepssrin @RedCarpetUp And besides, it has the additional benefit of sparking conversations with hitherto unknown interesting people!

Hail and well met!

@ravi_mohan @championswimmer @sandeepssrin @RedCarpetUp Strongly agree on the forcing people to company mandated therapists or worst off the same therapist. That isn't something I would support. 

Perhaps therapy reimbursement and strong internal push for people to engage along with a wide array of options is a starting point.

@tooldrool @championswimmer @sandeepssrin @RedCarpetUp And fwiw, Sandeep is a friend of mine, and I think Red Carpet is a great company ( this policy aside!)

This is all casual Twitter fencing and not to be taken very seriously (imho!)

@tooldrool @championswimmer @sandeepssrin @RedCarpetUp I think differences of opinion are *great*.

If two people think exactly alike, one is unnecessary!
@ravi_mohan @championswimmer @sandeepssrin @RedCarpetUp Glad that we could reach consensus even if partially. That too is rare these days!

@tooldrool @championswimmer @sandeepssrin @RedCarpetUp Lol at using astronauts as an example. FBI mandates lie detector tests over life history!

That said, I do agree with you that companies can mandate whatever they want. 

And (prospective) employees can decide not to work for such companies

All good. The wonders of capitalism!

@ravi_mohan @championswimmer @sandeepssrin @RedCarpetUp ... to day of an average individual. 

Given startups are often very stressful, I don't see how this shouldn't be a standard practice if the startup can afford it.

@ravi_mohan @championswimmer @sandeepssrin @RedCarpetUp While it may seem intrusive, I am sure there are jobs such as an astronaut that require you to undergo psych evaluation and then therapy to cope with what you are undertaking. 

Now that is coming from a more legacy view of the importance of mental health and its role in the day
